## Public Member Functions

### allocateScavengingFrameIndexesNearIncomingSP() {#a32a24ae8c2eb2f5acb96c1d33d4b949d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool SIFrameLowering::allocateScavengingFrameIndexesNearIncomingSP (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Control the placement of special register scavenging spill slots when allocating a stack frame.

If this returns true, the frame indexes used by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> will be allocated closest to the incoming stack pointer.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h/#l00052">52</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h">SIFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp/#l01736">1736</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp">SIFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### determineCalleeSaves() {#a7865e2cad3030c3c48b64c9cf1243d46}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SIFrameLowering::determineCalleeSaves (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bitvector">BitVector</a> &amp; SavedRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS=nullptr) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method determines which of the registers reported by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo/#ad71b5bc0aa81f5dec06cbfecaf2f7183">TargetRegisterInfo::getCalleeSavedRegs()</a> should actually get saved.

The default implementation checks populates the <code>SavedRegs</code> bitset with all registers which are modified in the function, targets may override this function to save additional registers. This method also sets up the register scavenger ensuring there is a free register or a frameindex available. This method should not be called by any passes outside of PEI, because it may change state passed in by <code>MF</code> and <code>RS</code>. The preferred interface outside PEI is getCalleeSaves.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h/#l00033">33</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h">SIFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp/#l01563">1563</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp">SIFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr() {#afb457df257778163977aebad1d1165e8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineBasicBlock::iterator SIFrameLowering::eliminateCallFramePseudoInstr (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#ae34c996b58df9b9ce6695a0c8b70c533">MachineBasicBlock::iterator</a> MI) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method is called during prolog/epilog code insertion to eliminate call frame setup and destroy pseudo instructions (but only if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a> is using them).

It is responsible for eliminating these instructions, replacing them with concrete instructions. This method need only be implemented if using call frame setup/destroy pseudo instructions. Returns an iterator pointing to the instruction after the replaced one.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h/#l00065">65</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h">SIFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp/#l01764">1764</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp">SIFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getFrameIndexReference() {#a1d2fa221d761f2dbaeb65823e305b8d7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StackOffset SIFrameLowering::getFrameIndexReference (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, int FI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &amp; FrameReg) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
getFrameIndexReference - This method should return the base register and offset used to reference a frame index location.

Returns the displacement from the frame register to the stack frame of the specified index, along with the frame register used (in output arg FrameReg).

The offset is returned directly, and the base register is returned via FrameReg.

This is the default implementation which is overridden for some targets.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h/#l00030">30</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h">SIFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp/#l01329">1329</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp">SIFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### processFunctionBeforeFrameFinalized() {#a24b80d6d36821f80675874283190f291}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SIFrameLowering::processFunctionBeforeFrameFinalized (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regscavenger">RegScavenger</a> &#42; RS=nullptr) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
processFunctionBeforeFrameFinalized - This method is called immediately before the specified function&#39;s frame layout (MF.getFrameInfo()) is finalized.

Once the frame is finalized, MO&#95;FrameIndex operands are replaced with direct constants. This method is optional.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h/#l00057">57</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-h">SIFrameLowering.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp/#l01338">1338</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siframelowering-cpp">SIFrameLowering.cpp</a>.
